blocks.name: df-syms
blocks.content: Define the class of all symmetric sets. It is used only by ~ df-symrels . Note the similarity of the definitions ~ df-refs , ~ df-syms and ~ df-trs , cf. the comment of ~ dfrefrels2 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 19-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: df-symrels
blocks.content: Define the class of symmetric relations. For sets, being an element of the class of symmetric relations is equivalent to satisfying the symmetric relation predicate, see ~ elsymrelsrel . Alternate definitions are ~ dfsymrels2 , ~ dfsymrels3 , ~ dfsymrels4 and ~ dfsymrels5 . This definition is similar to the definitions of the classes of reflexive ( ~ df-refrels ) and transitive ( ~ df-trrels ) relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 7-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: df-symrel
blocks.content: Define the symmetric relation predicate. (Read: ` R ` is a symmetric relation.) For sets, being an element of the class of symmetric relations ( ~ df-symrels ) is equivalent to satisfying the symmetric relation predicate, see ~ elsymrelsrel . Alternate definitions are ~ dfsymrel2 and ~ dfsymrel3 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 16-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: dfsymrels2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the class of symmetric relations. Cf. the comment of ~ dfrefrels2 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 20-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfsymrels2(setvar s0) {
  |- wceq(csymrels, crab(s0, crels, wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0))))
} = {
  abeqinbi(s0, csymrels, crels, csyms, wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0)), wbr(ccnv(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), cssr, cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))))
  df-symrels()
  df-syms(s0)
  syl5bb(wcel(cv(s0), crels), wbr(ccnv(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), cssr, cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0)), wss(ccnv(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))))
  ax-mp(wb(wbr(ccnv(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), cssr, cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), wss(ccnv(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))))), wcel(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), universe))
  elv(s0, wcel(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), universe))
  inex1g(cv(s0), universe, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))
  brssr(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), universe, ccnv(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))))
  sseq12d(ccnv(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0))))), cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0), wcel(cv(s0), crels))
  cnveqd(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0), wcel(cv(s0), crels))
  biimpi(wcel(cv(s0), crels), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0)))
  elv(s0, wb(wcel(cv(s0), crels), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0))))
  elrels6(cv(s0), universe)
  diff.crels.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dfsymrels2(setvar s0) {
  ‚ä¢ SymRels = { s0 ‚àà Rels | `' s0 ‚äÜ s0 }
} = {
  abeqinbi(s0, csymrels, crels, csyms, `' s0 ‚äÜ s0, `'(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))[_S](s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))))
  df-symrels()
  df-syms(s0)
  syl5bb(s0 ‚àà Rels, `'(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))[_S](s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), `' s0 ‚äÜ s0, `'(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))))
  ax-mp((`'(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))[_S](s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚Üî `'(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚äÜ(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))), (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚àà ùïå)
  elv(s0, (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))‚àà ùïå)
  inex1g(s0, universe, (dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))
  brssr((s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), universe, `'(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))))
  sseq12d(`'(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), `' s0, s0, s0 ‚àà Rels)
  cnveqd((s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0))), s0, s0 ‚àà Rels)
  biimpi(s0 ‚àà Rels, (s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))= s0)
  elv(s0, (s0 ‚àà Rels ‚Üî(s0 ‚ãÇ(dom(s0)√ó ran(s0)))= s0))
  elrels6(s0, universe)
  diff.crels.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: dfsymrels3
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the class of symmetric relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 22-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfsymrels3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wceq(csymrels, crab(s0, crels, wal(s1, wal(s2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  rabbieq(s0, csymrels, crels, wal(s1, wal(s2, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0)))
  dfsymrels2(s0)
  cnvsym(s1, s2, cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
}

blocks.name: dfsymrels5
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the class of symmetric relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 22-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfsymrels5(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wceq(csymrels, crab(s0, crels, wal(s1, wal(s2, wb(wbr(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  rabimbieq(s0, csymrels, crels, wal(s1, wal(s2, wb(wbr(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wceq(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0)))
  dfsymrels4(s0)
  elrelscnveq2(s1, s2, cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
}

blocks.name: elsymrels3
blocks.content: Element of the class of symmetric relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 17-Aug-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm elsymrels3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, csymrels), wa(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wcel(c0, crels)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, csymrels, crels, wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))
  dfsymrels3(hs0, s0, s1)
  2albidv(s0, s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))
  breq(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  breq(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s1), cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elsymrels3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà SymRels ‚Üî(‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ‚Üí s1[c0]s0)))‚àß c0 ‚àà Rels))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, csymrels, crels, ‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ‚Üí s1[c0]s0))), ‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[hs0]s1 ‚Üí s1[hs0]s0))))
  dfsymrels3(hs0, s0, s1)
  2albidv(s0, s1, hs0 = c0, (s0[hs0]s1 ‚Üí s1[hs0]s0), (s0[c0]s1 ‚Üí s1[c0]s0))
  imbi12d(hs0 = c0, s0[hs0]s1, s1[hs0]s0, s0[c0]s1, s1[c0]s0)
  breq(hs0, c0, s0, s1)
  breq(hs0, c0, s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ‚Üí s1[c0]s0))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: elsymrels5
blocks.content: Element of the class of symmetric relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 17-Aug-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm elsymrels5(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, csymrels), wa(wal(s0, wal(s1, wb(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wcel(c0, crels)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, csymrels, crels, wal(s0, wal(s1, wb(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wal(s0, wal(s1, wb(wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))
  dfsymrels5(hs0, s0, s1)
  2albidv(s0, s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wb(wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wb(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))
  bibi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(s0), cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))
  breq(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  breq(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s1), cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w(wal(s0, wal(s1, wb(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elsymrels5(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà SymRels ‚Üî(‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ‚Üî s1[c0]s0)))‚àß c0 ‚àà Rels))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  rabeqel(hs0, c0, csymrels, crels, ‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ‚Üî s1[c0]s0))), ‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[hs0]s1 ‚Üî s1[hs0]s0))))
  dfsymrels5(hs0, s0, s1)
  2albidv(s0, s1, hs0 = c0, (s0[hs0]s1 ‚Üî s1[hs0]s0), (s0[c0]s1 ‚Üî s1[c0]s0))
  bibi12d(hs0 = c0, s0[hs0]s1, s1[hs0]s0, s0[c0]s1, s1[c0]s0)
  breq(hs0, c0, s0, s1)
  breq(hs0, c0, s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(crels)
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ‚Üî s1[c0]s0))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: elsymrelsrel
blocks.content: For sets, being an element of the class of symmetric relations ( ~ df-symrels ) is equivalent to satisfying the symmetric relation predicate. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 17-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: symreleq
blocks.content: Equality theorem for symmetric relation. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 15-Apr-2019.) (Revised by Peter Mazsa, 23-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: symrelim
blocks.content: Symmetric relation implies that the domain and the range are equal. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 29-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: symrelcoss
blocks.content: The class of cosets by ` R ` is symmetric. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 20-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: idsymrel
blocks.content: The identity relation is symmetric. (Contributed by AV, 19-Jun-2022.)

blocks.name: epnsymrel
blocks.content: The membership (epsilon) relation is not symmetric. (Contributed by AV, 18-Jun-2022.)
